medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right sided abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began after eating dinner on an unspecified date. The pain was described as cramping and severe, initially located in the epigastric region, but slowly migrated towards the right side and lower abdomen. The pain persisted overnight and into the morning, prompting the patient to seek evaluation in the emergency department. Notably, he was able to eat breakfast and drink well on the morning of his visit.
